</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/stories/Pages/story-bulletin.aspx?num=9237">

</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Fishing for a petroleum replacement</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Matthew Perkins  started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/stories/Pages/story-impact.aspx?num=9500">

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/from-montreal-to-a-menu-near-you/">

</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Clearing the air</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/sissi-liu-co-founder-and-ceo-of-metalmark-innovations">

</figure>

<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Democratizing access to climate finance</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/democratizing-access-to-climate-finance/">

<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Cultivating microbes that help the world</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products.
</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/circe-bioscience-licenses-technology-to-decarbonize-industry-with-microbes-developed-at-wyss-institute-at-harvard-university/">

</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Slowing down spoilage</h3>

		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.</p></div>

</figure>

	<div class="c-card__content">

		
		
<h3 class="c-card__title" id="p-6848e080de06b-title">
	<span>Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger</span></h3>

		
		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.</p></div>

	</div>

</figure>

	<div class="c-card__content">

		
		
<h3 class="c-card__title" id="p-6848e080de098-title">
	<span>Helping organizations do good in Jamaica</span></h3>

		
		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.</p></div>

	</div>

<p>When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.</p></div>

Navigation Quick Links
  1. A to Z index
  2. Find a person
  3. Events
  4. Media Relations
  5. Alumni
  6. Give Now
  7. Emergency
Harvard University

Harvard University

Ideas to Enterprise

Across Harvards campus, our students, scholars, and faculty turn ideas into ventures that solve problems and create value.

Foundational principles of leadership

In this free online course you can explore strategies for leading in a changing world, new ways to approach complex organizational systems, and how to take thoughtful action.

Harvards impact

A 2015 study explored the impact that Harvard has in the business world.

  • 146,000 ventures

    Harvard alumni have founded

  • 20 million people

    employed by those ventures

  • $3.9 trillion

    generated in annual revenue

How does innovation move from lab to market?

Turning ideas into enterprise

Chief Technology Development Officer Isaac T. Kohlberg explains how Harvards Office of Technology Development helps researchers and scientists at the University bring their innovations and discoveries to the market.

Student and alumni founders representing 12 different Harvard schools

Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenge

Founders with bright futures

Helping mothers protect their bodies during childbirth, reimagining how hydrogen can be transported safely and affordably, and leveraging AI and robotics to transform the thousands-year-old process of hair braiding are a few of the 2025 Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenges extraordinary winning ventures.

Learn more about the innovation challenge

The business of better health

These businesses join a history that includes Massachusetts General Hospital, founded by alum John Bartlett, and Partners in Health, founded by alum Paul Farmer.

Explore more emerging health technologies

Creating a new class of antibiotics

Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases.

Creating a new class of antibiotics

Pioneering regenerative medicine

Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair.

Pioneering regenerative medicine

Decreasing eating disorder risk

Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk.

Decreasing eating disorder risk

Detecting deadly lacing agents

MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs.

Detecting deadly lacing agents

Transforming health care

Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients.

Transforming health care

Listening to patients' needs

Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.

Fostering the future

Harvard has several places where we help students and faculty turn research into start-up reality.

  • Harvard Innovation Labs
  • Harvard Grid
  • Office of Technology Development

Education Entrepreneurs

These businesses join a history that includes alum Walter William Spencer Cook, co-founder of the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, and alum Edith Lesley, founder of Lesley University.

Explore more businesses making a social impact

Exploring emotions through art

Manasi Mehan and Chhavi Khandelwal founded Saturday Art Class to provide visual arts and social emotional learning education to children across India.

Joe Wolf believes his Imagine Worldwide can solve the literacy and numeracy crisis in sub-Saharan Africa.

Empowering the next leaders

Joy Lindsay founded Butterfly Dreamz to help teen girls and young women from underserved communities become leaders.

Supporting social-emotional development

When Jenny Woo created 52 Essential Conversations she aimed to help parents and educators through difficult conversations.

Team players

Getting it over the net

With League One Volleyball (LOVB) Katlyn Gao and Kim Kitchens designed a volleyball ecosystem from scratch.

Learn more about LOVB

Promoting adaptive sports

Jorge Perez de Leza founded Fundacin Deporte y Desafo (Sport and Challenge Foundation) to provide athletic and recreational opportunities to people with disabilities in his home country of Spain.

Learn more about Fundacin Deporte y Desafo

Founding the future of technology

These businesses join a history that includes alum Dan Bricklins VisiCalc, the first independent software company, and alum Scott McNealys Sun Microsystems, which created the Java programming language.

Explore more technological innovators

Computing with quantum

John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.

Finding his focus

Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies.

Finding his focus

Building together

Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.

Touching the future

Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology.

Touching the future

Solving debt

Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt.

Solving debt

Owning your health

Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data.

Owning your health

Earth-friendly enterprises

These businesses join a history that includes alum Thomas Jaggars Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and alum Mark Plotkins Amazon Conservation Team.

Explore more climate related businesses

Cooling without warming the globe

A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently.
Learn more about Trellis Air

Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases

Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.

Fishing for a petroleum replacement

Matthew Perkins started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.

Spinning up a new food

Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.
Learn more about Tender Food

Clearing the air

Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.
Learn more about Metalmark

Democratizing access to climate finance

Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.
Learn more about NetaCarbon

Cultivating microbes that help the world

Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products.
Learn more about Circe

Slowing down spoilage

Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.
Learn more about Mori

Solving global problems

Cultivating prosperity for farmers

Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.

Learn more about Rumi Spice

Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger

When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.

Learn more about Cassvita
Learn more about Cassvita

Helping organizations do good in Jamaica

Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.

Learn more about Do Good Jamaica
Learn more about Do Good Jamaica

Perfecting a new language

When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.

Learn more about BoldVoice

#  Harvard University 
##  Ideas to Enterprise
Across Harvards campus, our students, scholars, and faculty turn ideas into ventures that solve problems and create value.
## [Foundational principles of leadership](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles)
In this [free online course](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles) you can explore strategies for leading in a changing world, new ways to approach complex organizational systems, and how to take thoughtful action.
##  Harvards impact
A 2015 study explored the impact that Harvard has in the business world.
  * 146,000 ventures
**Harvard alumni have founded**
  * 20 million people
**employed by those ventures**
  * $3.9 trillion
**generated in annual revenue**


![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/16x9.png)
How does innovation move from lab to market? 
##  Turning ideas into enterprise
Chief Technology Development Officer Isaac T. Kohlberg explains how Harvards Office of Technology Development helps researchers and scientists at the University bring their innovations and discoveries to the market.
![A group of company founders](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/four-three.png)
Student and alumni founders representing 12 different Harvard schools
Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenge
##  Founders with bright futures
Helping mothers protect their bodies during childbirth, reimagining how hydrogen can be transported safely and affordably, and leveraging AI and robotics to transform the thousands-year-old process of hair braiding are a few of the 2025 Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenges extraordinary winning ventures.
[ Learn more about the innovation challenge  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/05/redefining-whats-possible/)
##  The business of better health
These businesses join a history that includes Massachusetts General Hospital, founded by alum John Bartlett, and Partners in Health, founded by alum Paul Farmer.
[ Explore more emerging health technologies  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/industry-investors/emerging-technologies/)
![A person in a lab using a petri dish](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/kinvard-bio-lab.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Creating a new class of antibiotics
Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases.
[ Creating a new class of antibiotics ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/02/harvard-startup-creating-a-new-class-of-antibiotics-antimicrobial-resistance/)
###  Pioneering regenerative medicine
Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair.
![Nabiha Saklayen](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Nabiha-Saklayen-924.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Pioneering regenerative medicine ](https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/physicist-heal-thyself)
###  Decreasing eating disorder risk
Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk.
![Amanda Moreno](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Untitled-design-28.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Decreasing eating disorder risk ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/body-empowerment-project)
###  Detecting deadly lacing agents
MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs.
![Skye Lam and Vienna Sparks](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Skye-and-Vienna-filtered-1.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Detecting deadly lacing agents ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/mablab)
###  Transforming health care
Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients.
![Ivan Hsiao](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Ivan-Hsiao-PIC-pitch.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Transforming health care ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/trans-health-interview)
###  Listening to patients' needs
Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.
![Manny Simons](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9405_Simons_288w.jpg?w=288&h=281&crop=1)
##  Fostering the future
Harvard has several places where we help students and faculty turn research into start-up reality.
  * [ Harvard Innovation Labs  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Harvard Grid  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Office of Technology Development  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/)


##  Education Entrepreneurs
These businesses join a history that includes alum Walter William Spencer Cook, co-founder of the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, and alum Edith Lesley, founder of Lesley University.
[ Explore more businesses making a social impact  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/ventures/siff-recipients)
### [Exploring emotions through art](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/saturday-art-class)
Manasi Mehan and Chhavi Khandelwal founded Saturday Art Class to provide visual arts and social emotional learning education to children across India.
Joe Wolf believes his Imagine Worldwide can solve the literacy and numeracy crisis in sub-Saharan Africa.
### [Empowering the next leaders](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/butterfly-dreamz)
Joy Lindsay founded Butterfly Dreamz to help teen girls and young women from underserved communities become leaders.
### [Supporting social-emotional development](https://www.gse.harvard.edu/ideas/news/18/09/power-conversation)
When Jenny Woo created 52 Essential Conversations she aimed to help parents and educators through difficult conversations.
##  Team players
###  Getting it over the net
With League One Volleyball (LOVB) Katlyn Gao and Kim Kitchens designed a volleyball ecosystem from scratch.
Learn more about LOVB 
###  Promoting adaptive sports
Jorge Perez de Leza founded Fundacin Deporte y Desafo (Sport and Challenge Foundation) to provide athletic and recreational opportunities to people with disabilities in his home country of Spain.
Learn more about Fundacin Deporte y Desafo 
##  Founding the future of technology
These businesses join a history that includes alum Dan Bricklins VisiCalc, the first independent software company, and alum Scott McNealys Sun Microsystems, which created the Java programming language.
[ Explore more technological innovators  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/startups-licensing/)
![A person in front of a large tubed system](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9432_p58_Quantum.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Computing with quantum
John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.
###  Finding his focus
Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies.
![Rob Devlin](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/METALENZ-RobDevlin-1920.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Finding his focus ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/03/from-harvard-lab-to-your-living-room/?utm_source=SilverpopMailing&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Daily%20%20Gazette%2020250326%20\(1\)&spMailingID=35875060&spUserID=MjE3NjUwMDkwMDA4S0&spJobID=2863966602&spReportId=Mjg2Mzk2NjYwMgS2)
###  Building together
Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.
![Shruti Shruti](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9153_Shruti_880wb.jpg?w=375&h=258&crop=1)
###  Touching the future
Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology.
![Simon Chaput](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_9d6402d7c3fb43048628a1ca47a92011mv2b.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Touching the future ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/simon-chaput-president-and-founder-of-bor%C3%A9as-technologies)
###  Solving debt
Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt. 
![Rohan Pavuluri](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-02-at-11.14.39AM.png?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Solving debt ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2020/12/interview-upsolve-founder-rohan-pavuluri-18)
###  Owning your health
Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data.
![Laura Wegner talking to a crowd about her company Mii](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/HealthLab-Pitch-edited.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Owning your health ](https://globalhealth.harvard.edu/championing-health-tech-innovation-across-borders/)
##  Earth-friendly enterprises
These businesses join a history that includes alum Thomas Jaggars Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and alum Mark Plotkins Amazon Conservation Team.
[ Explore more climate related businesses  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/news/four-harvard-research-teams-receive-translational-funding-to-advance-climate-change-tech/)
![](https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/01_Membrane_Fun_trellis-1920.jpg)
###  Cooling without warming the globe
A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently.
[ Learn more about Trellis Air  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/04/ac-use-to-surge-as-world-gets-hotter-harvard-startup-has-a-solution-climate-change/)
![](https://cloudinary.hbs.edu/hbsit/image/upload/s--BkyoUPiC--/f_auto,c_fill,h_360,w_640,/v20200101/2EB56C582389B82071DE566ED3EC4457.jpg)
###  Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases
Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.
![](https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/PublishingImages/stories/bulletin/2024/december/next/9500-kelp-thumb.gif)
###  Fishing for a petroleum replacement
Matthew Perkins started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/04/02100514/cropped-Luke_fun-scaled-e1713810011212.jpg)
###  Spinning up a new food
Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.
[ Learn more about Tender Food  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/from-montreal-to-a-menu-near-you/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_efdfc99b7a2d434bae83302e16732f21mv2.png?w=400&h=407&crop=1)
###  Clearing the air
Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.
[ Learn more about Metalmark  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/sissi-liu-co-founder-and-ceo-of-metalmark-innovations)
![](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Dec-9-1-copy.jpg)
###  Democratizing access to climate finance
Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.
[ Learn more about NetaCarbon  ](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/democratizing-access-to-climate-finance/)
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/05/14152629/cropped-D85_48581.jpg)
###  Cultivating microbes that help the world
Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products. 
[ Learn more about Circe  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/circe-bioscience-licenses-technology-to-decarbonize-industry-with-microbes-developed-at-wyss-institute-at-harvard-university/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_b19c8e8c7cad4017b31c6be3bcdc90bcmv2.png?w=400&h=400&crop=1)
###  Slowing down spoilage
Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.
[ Learn more about Mori  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/adam-behrens-ph)
##  Solving global problems
###  Cultivating prosperity for farmers
Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.
Learn more about Rumi Spice 
###  Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger
When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.
Learn more about Cassvita 
[ Learn more about Cassvita ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/cassvita)
###  Helping organizations do good in Jamaica
Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.
Learn more about Do Good Jamaica 
[ Learn more about Do Good Jamaica ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2024/06/alumni-profile-deika-morrison-sm-98)
###  Perfecting a new language
When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.
Learn more about BoldVoice 
You may also like

		<style id="wp-custom-css">
			/* on the history page, make the line full height for now */
.page-harvard-history .the-follower{
	height: 100% !important;
}
/* on the history page, make the line not run through the red dots */
.page-harvard-history .c-block--width-grid:not(.c-block--layout-center) .b-timeline__container:before,
.page-harvard-history .c-block--width-grid:not(.c-block--layout-center) .b-timeline__container:after {
	z-index: 2;
}

/* temporary fix to give a max-width to the hero underline */

.b-hero .c-content-block__underline {
	margin-left: auto;
	margin-right: auto;
	max-width: 624px;
}

/* colorful hr */
.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr {
    margin-bottom:20px;
}

.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr:after{
    border-bottom-width: 20px;
    height: 20px;
}

.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr.color-ivy:after{
    border-bottom-color: #52854c;
}

.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr.color-blue:after{
    border-bottom-color: #4e84c4;
}

.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr.color-saffron:after{
    border-bottom-color: #d16103;
}

.wp-block-separator.colorful-hr.color-lemon:after{
    border-bottom-color: #ffdb6d;
}

/* section header - tall line and color options */
.b-header.c-block.tall-line .b-header__border:after {
    border-bottom-width: 20px;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-saffron .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #d16103;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-blue .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #4e84c4;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-ivy .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #52854c;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-lemon .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #ffdb6d;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-indigo .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #0A2240;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-mortar .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #99918F;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-slate .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #8996A0;
}

.b-header.c-block.color-crimson .b-header__border:after {
    border-color: #A51C30;
}

/** 
Temporary fix for Firefox v 78  
removed 
:not(.is-style-XX-Large.has-text-align-center)
**/
.t-sink > .wp-block-group__inner-container > :not(.c-block):not(.alignwide):not(.html-alignwide):not(.align-wide):not(.alignfull):not(.wp-block-embed):not(.is-style-pull-quote) {
    max-width: 624px;
    width: calc(100% - 48px);
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
}

/**
 * Page specific fix
 * Looking back in 2021 In Focus
 * remove space above video
 */
.postid-23525 .c-block.hide-border .b-header__container .b-header__border{
	display: none;
}

.page-id-6392 .c-block.hide-border .b-header__container .b-header__border{
	display: none;
}

/**
 * Try out smooth scroll behavior
 * */
html {
	scroll-behavior: smooth;
}

 * 4/20/2023: Fix for event list display issue, handling both events with link and without
 * */
.b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card {
		display: block;
}

.b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card, .b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card__b-event {
	border-top: 1px solid #c4c5c6;
	padding: 48px 0;
	margin: 0 24px;
}

.compact-event-list.b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card, .compact-event-list.b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card__b-event {
	padding: 24px 0;
}

@media screen and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1200px) {
  .b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card, .b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card__b-event {
	padding: 24px 0;
	margin: 0 12px;
}
}

@media screen and (max-width: 767px) {
  .b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card, .b-events-grid.list_layout .g-3-up>.c-card__b-event {
	padding: 24px 0;
		margin: 0;
}
}

.b-events-grid.list_layout .c-card .c-card {
	border: 0;
	padding: 0;
}

/**
 * 10/17/2023, fix video control issue
 * **/
.c-video__block .c-video {
    position: relative;
}

/** 
 * 1/16/2024, Compact margin for side-by-side blocks 
 * **/
.c-block.b-side-by-side {
	margin-top: 0 !important;
	margin-bottom: 0 !important;
}

/** 4/5/2024m Gravity form poll results color fix **/
.gform_confirmation_wrapper:not(.gform-theme--framework) .gpoll_container .red .gpoll_ratio_box {
    background-color: #A51C30;
}

.gform_confirmation_wrapper:not(.gform-theme--framework) .gpoll_container  .gpoll_bar_juice:after{
	background-image: none;
}

.gform_confirmation_wrapper:not(.gform-theme--framework) .gpoll_container .red .gpoll_bar_juice {
    background-image: linear-gradient(#A51C30, #A51C30);
    box-shadow: none;
}

#gform_confirmation_wrapper_28 {
	margin: 0 auto;
	padding: 25px;
}		</style>

					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/PublishingImages/stories/bulletin/2024/december/next/9500-kelp-thumb.gif">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Fishing for a petroleum replacement</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Matthew Perkins  started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/stories/Pages/story-impact.aspx?num=9500">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about Macro Oceans			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
							<div class="c-slider--carousel-pull-right__slide c-slider__slide swiper-slide">
					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/04/02100514/cropped-Luke_fun-scaled-e1713810011212.jpg">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Spinning up a new food</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/from-montreal-to-a-menu-near-you/">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about Tender Food			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
							<div class="c-slider--carousel-pull-right__slide c-slider__slide swiper-slide">
					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_efdfc99b7a2d434bae83302e16732f21mv2.png?w=400&h=407&crop=1" width="400" height="407">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Clearing the air</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/sissi-liu-co-founder-and-ceo-of-metalmark-innovations">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about Metalmark			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
							<div class="c-slider--carousel-pull-right__slide c-slider__slide swiper-slide">
					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Dec-9-1-copy.jpg">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Democratizing access to climate finance</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/democratizing-access-to-climate-finance/">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about NetaCarbon			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
							<div class="c-slider--carousel-pull-right__slide c-slider__slide swiper-slide">
					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/05/14152629/cropped-D85_48581.jpg">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Cultivating microbes that help the world</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products.
</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/circe-bioscience-licenses-technology-to-decarbonize-industry-with-microbes-developed-at-wyss-institute-at-harvard-university/">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about Circe			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
							<div class="c-slider--carousel-pull-right__slide c-slider__slide swiper-slide">
					<div class="b-featured-stories__wrapper"><div class="b-featured-stories__img">
<figure class=" c-image">

	
		<img decoding="async" class=" c-image__image" alt="" src="https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_b19c8e8c7cad4017b31c6be3bcdc90bcmv2.png?w=400&h=400&crop=1" width="400" height="400">
	
	
</figure>

</div><div class="b-featured-stories__slide-content t-sink s-sink">
<h3 class="b-featured-stories__slide-title">
	Slowing down spoilage</h3>

<div class="b-featured-stories__slide-desc t-sink">
	Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.</div>
<a class="b-featured-stories__slide-cta a-btn a-btn-secondary a-btn--arrow-right " data-js="b-featured-stories-cta" href="https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/adam-behrens-ph">
			<span class="a-btn__text">
			Learn more about Mori			</span>
	</a>
</div></div>				</div>
					</div>

		
	</div>

	
			<div class="c-slider__arrows">
			<div class="c-slider__button c-slider__button--prev swiper-button-prev swiper-button-disabled" data-swiper-direction="prev"></div>
			<div class="c-slider__button c-slider__button--next swiper-button-next" data-swiper-direction="next"></div>
		</div>
	
</div>

</section>

		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.</p></div>

	</div>

	
	<div class="c-card__cta" aria-hidden="true">

</figure>
		</div>
	
	<div class="c-card__content">

		
		
<h3 class="c-card__title" id="p-6848e080de06b-title">
	<span>Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger</span></h3>

		
		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.</p></div>

	</div>

	
	<div class="c-card__cta" aria-hidden="true">

	<a class="c-card__wrapper-link" id="p-6848e080de06b-link" aria-labelledby="p-6848e080de06b-title" aria-describedby="p-6848e080de06b-link" data-js="target-link" href="https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/cassvita">

</figure>
		</div>
	
	<div class="c-card__content">

		
		
<h3 class="c-card__title" id="p-6848e080de098-title">
	<span>Helping organizations do good in Jamaica</span></h3>

		
		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.</p></div>

	</div>

	
	<div class="c-card__cta" aria-hidden="true">
<div class="c-block__cta-link a-btn a-btn-outline is-style-light a-btn--arrow-right ">

</figure>

<h3 class="c-card__title" id="p-6848e080de0ba-title">

		<div class="t-sink s-sink c-card__description">
<p>When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.</p></div>

	</div>

Harvard University

Harvard University

Ideas to Enterprise

Across Harvards campus, our students, scholars, and faculty turn ideas into ventures that solve problems and create value.

Foundational principles of leadership

In this free online course you can explore strategies for leading in a changing world, new ways to approach complex organizational systems, and how to take thoughtful action.

Harvards impact

A 2015 study explored the impact that Harvard has in the business world.

  • 146,000 ventures

    Harvard alumni have founded

  • 20 million people

    employed by those ventures

  • $3.9 trillion

    generated in annual revenue

How does innovation move from lab to market?

Turning ideas into enterprise

Chief Technology Development Officer Isaac T. Kohlberg explains how Harvards Office of Technology Development helps researchers and scientists at the University bring their innovations and discoveries to the market.

Student and alumni founders representing 12 different Harvard schools

Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenge

Founders with bright futures

Helping mothers protect their bodies during childbirth, reimagining how hydrogen can be transported safely and affordably, and leveraging AI and robotics to transform the thousands-year-old process of hair braiding are a few of the 2025 Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenges extraordinary winning ventures.

Learn more about the innovation challenge

The business of better health

These businesses join a history that includes Massachusetts General Hospital, founded by alum John Bartlett, and Partners in Health, founded by alum Paul Farmer.

Explore more emerging health technologies

Creating a new class of antibiotics

Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases.

Creating a new class of antibiotics

Pioneering regenerative medicine

Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair.

Pioneering regenerative medicine

Decreasing eating disorder risk

Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk.

Decreasing eating disorder risk

Detecting deadly lacing agents

MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs.

Detecting deadly lacing agents

Transforming health care

Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients.

Transforming health care

Listening to patients' needs

Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.

Fostering the future

Harvard has several places where we help students and faculty turn research into start-up reality.

  • Harvard Innovation Labs
  • Harvard Grid
  • Office of Technology Development

Education Entrepreneurs

These businesses join a history that includes alum Walter William Spencer Cook, co-founder of the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, and alum Edith Lesley, founder of Lesley University.

Explore more businesses making a social impact

Exploring emotions through art

Manasi Mehan and Chhavi Khandelwal founded Saturday Art Class to provide visual arts and social emotional learning education to children across India.

Joe Wolf believes his Imagine Worldwide can solve the literacy and numeracy crisis in sub-Saharan Africa.

Empowering the next leaders

Joy Lindsay founded Butterfly Dreamz to help teen girls and young women from underserved communities become leaders.

Supporting social-emotional development

When Jenny Woo created 52 Essential Conversations she aimed to help parents and educators through difficult conversations.

Team players

Getting it over the net

With League One Volleyball (LOVB) Katlyn Gao and Kim Kitchens designed a volleyball ecosystem from scratch.

Learn more about LOVB

Promoting adaptive sports

Jorge Perez de Leza founded Fundacin Deporte y Desafo (Sport and Challenge Foundation) to provide athletic and recreational opportunities to people with disabilities in his home country of Spain.

Learn more about Fundacin Deporte y Desafo

Founding the future of technology

These businesses join a history that includes alum Dan Bricklins VisiCalc, the first independent software company, and alum Scott McNealys Sun Microsystems, which created the Java programming language.

Explore more technological innovators

Computing with quantum

John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.

Finding his focus

Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies.

Finding his focus

Building together

Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.

Touching the future

Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology.

Touching the future

Solving debt

Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt.

Solving debt

Owning your health

Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data.

Owning your health

Earth-friendly enterprises

These businesses join a history that includes alum Thomas Jaggars Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and alum Mark Plotkins Amazon Conservation Team.

Explore more climate related businesses

Cooling without warming the globe

A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently.
Learn more about Trellis Air

Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases

Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.

Fishing for a petroleum replacement

Matthew Perkins started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.

Spinning up a new food

Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.
Learn more about Tender Food

Clearing the air

Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.
Learn more about Metalmark

Democratizing access to climate finance

Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.
Learn more about NetaCarbon

Cultivating microbes that help the world

Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products.
Learn more about Circe

Slowing down spoilage

Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.
Learn more about Mori

Solving global problems

Cultivating prosperity for farmers

Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.

Learn more about Rumi Spice

Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger

When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.

Learn more about Cassvita
Learn more about Cassvita

Helping organizations do good in Jamaica

Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.

Learn more about Do Good Jamaica
Learn more about Do Good Jamaica

Perfecting a new language

When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.

Learn more about BoldVoice

#  Harvard University 
##  Ideas to Enterprise
Across Harvards campus, our students, scholars, and faculty turn ideas into ventures that solve problems and create value.
## [Foundational principles of leadership](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles)
In this [free online course](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles) you can explore strategies for leading in a changing world, new ways to approach complex organizational systems, and how to take thoughtful action.
##  Harvards impact
A 2015 study explored the impact that Harvard has in the business world.
  * 146,000 ventures
**Harvard alumni have founded**
  * 20 million people
**employed by those ventures**
  * $3.9 trillion
**generated in annual revenue**


![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/16x9.png)
How does innovation move from lab to market? 
##  Turning ideas into enterprise
Chief Technology Development Officer Isaac T. Kohlberg explains how Harvards Office of Technology Development helps researchers and scientists at the University bring their innovations and discoveries to the market.
![A group of company founders](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/four-three.png)
Student and alumni founders representing 12 different Harvard schools
Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenge
##  Founders with bright futures
Helping mothers protect their bodies during childbirth, reimagining how hydrogen can be transported safely and affordably, and leveraging AI and robotics to transform the thousands-year-old process of hair braiding are a few of the 2025 Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenges extraordinary winning ventures.
[ Learn more about the innovation challenge  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/05/redefining-whats-possible/)
##  The business of better health
These businesses join a history that includes Massachusetts General Hospital, founded by alum John Bartlett, and Partners in Health, founded by alum Paul Farmer.
[ Explore more emerging health technologies  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/industry-investors/emerging-technologies/)
![A person in a lab using a petri dish](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/kinvard-bio-lab.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Creating a new class of antibiotics
Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases.
[ Creating a new class of antibiotics ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/02/harvard-startup-creating-a-new-class-of-antibiotics-antimicrobial-resistance/)
###  Pioneering regenerative medicine
Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair.
![Nabiha Saklayen](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Nabiha-Saklayen-924.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Pioneering regenerative medicine ](https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/physicist-heal-thyself)
###  Decreasing eating disorder risk
Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk.
![Amanda Moreno](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Untitled-design-28.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Decreasing eating disorder risk ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/body-empowerment-project)
###  Detecting deadly lacing agents
MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs.
![Skye Lam and Vienna Sparks](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Skye-and-Vienna-filtered-1.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Detecting deadly lacing agents ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/mablab)
###  Transforming health care
Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients.
![Ivan Hsiao](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Ivan-Hsiao-PIC-pitch.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Transforming health care ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/trans-health-interview)
###  Listening to patients' needs
Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.
![Manny Simons](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9405_Simons_288w.jpg?w=288&h=281&crop=1)
##  Fostering the future
Harvard has several places where we help students and faculty turn research into start-up reality.
  * [ Harvard Innovation Labs  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Harvard Grid  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Office of Technology Development  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/)


##  Education Entrepreneurs
These businesses join a history that includes alum Walter William Spencer Cook, co-founder of the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, and alum Edith Lesley, founder of Lesley University.
[ Explore more businesses making a social impact  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/ventures/siff-recipients)
### [Exploring emotions through art](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/saturday-art-class)
Manasi Mehan and Chhavi Khandelwal founded Saturday Art Class to provide visual arts and social emotional learning education to children across India.
Joe Wolf believes his Imagine Worldwide can solve the literacy and numeracy crisis in sub-Saharan Africa.
### [Empowering the next leaders](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/butterfly-dreamz)
Joy Lindsay founded Butterfly Dreamz to help teen girls and young women from underserved communities become leaders.
### [Supporting social-emotional development](https://www.gse.harvard.edu/ideas/news/18/09/power-conversation)
When Jenny Woo created 52 Essential Conversations she aimed to help parents and educators through difficult conversations.
##  Team players
###  Getting it over the net
With League One Volleyball (LOVB) Katlyn Gao and Kim Kitchens designed a volleyball ecosystem from scratch.
Learn more about LOVB 
###  Promoting adaptive sports
Jorge Perez de Leza founded Fundacin Deporte y Desafo (Sport and Challenge Foundation) to provide athletic and recreational opportunities to people with disabilities in his home country of Spain.
Learn more about Fundacin Deporte y Desafo 
##  Founding the future of technology
These businesses join a history that includes alum Dan Bricklins VisiCalc, the first independent software company, and alum Scott McNealys Sun Microsystems, which created the Java programming language.
[ Explore more technological innovators  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/startups-licensing/)
![A person in front of a large tubed system](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9432_p58_Quantum.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Computing with quantum
John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.
###  Finding his focus
Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies.
![Rob Devlin](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/METALENZ-RobDevlin-1920.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Finding his focus ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/03/from-harvard-lab-to-your-living-room/?utm_source=SilverpopMailing&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Daily%20%20Gazette%2020250326%20\(1\)&spMailingID=35875060&spUserID=MjE3NjUwMDkwMDA4S0&spJobID=2863966602&spReportId=Mjg2Mzk2NjYwMgS2)
###  Building together
Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.
![Shruti Shruti](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9153_Shruti_880wb.jpg?w=375&h=258&crop=1)
###  Touching the future
Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology.
![Simon Chaput](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_9d6402d7c3fb43048628a1ca47a92011mv2b.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Touching the future ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/simon-chaput-president-and-founder-of-bor%C3%A9as-technologies)
###  Solving debt
Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt. 
![Rohan Pavuluri](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-02-at-11.14.39AM.png?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Solving debt ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2020/12/interview-upsolve-founder-rohan-pavuluri-18)
###  Owning your health
Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data.
![Laura Wegner talking to a crowd about her company Mii](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/HealthLab-Pitch-edited.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Owning your health ](https://globalhealth.harvard.edu/championing-health-tech-innovation-across-borders/)
##  Earth-friendly enterprises
These businesses join a history that includes alum Thomas Jaggars Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and alum Mark Plotkins Amazon Conservation Team.
[ Explore more climate related businesses  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/news/four-harvard-research-teams-receive-translational-funding-to-advance-climate-change-tech/)
![](https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/01_Membrane_Fun_trellis-1920.jpg)
###  Cooling without warming the globe
A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently.
[ Learn more about Trellis Air  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/04/ac-use-to-surge-as-world-gets-hotter-harvard-startup-has-a-solution-climate-change/)
![](https://cloudinary.hbs.edu/hbsit/image/upload/s--BkyoUPiC--/f_auto,c_fill,h_360,w_640,/v20200101/2EB56C582389B82071DE566ED3EC4457.jpg)
###  Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases
Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.
![](https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/PublishingImages/stories/bulletin/2024/december/next/9500-kelp-thumb.gif)
###  Fishing for a petroleum replacement
Matthew Perkins started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/04/02100514/cropped-Luke_fun-scaled-e1713810011212.jpg)
###  Spinning up a new food
Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.
[ Learn more about Tender Food  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/from-montreal-to-a-menu-near-you/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_efdfc99b7a2d434bae83302e16732f21mv2.png?w=400&h=407&crop=1)
###  Clearing the air
Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.
[ Learn more about Metalmark  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/sissi-liu-co-founder-and-ceo-of-metalmark-innovations)
![](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Dec-9-1-copy.jpg)
###  Democratizing access to climate finance
Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.
[ Learn more about NetaCarbon  ](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/democratizing-access-to-climate-finance/)
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/05/14152629/cropped-D85_48581.jpg)
###  Cultivating microbes that help the world
Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products. 
[ Learn more about Circe  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/circe-bioscience-licenses-technology-to-decarbonize-industry-with-microbes-developed-at-wyss-institute-at-harvard-university/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_b19c8e8c7cad4017b31c6be3bcdc90bcmv2.png?w=400&h=400&crop=1)
###  Slowing down spoilage
Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.
[ Learn more about Mori  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/adam-behrens-ph)
##  Solving global problems
###  Cultivating prosperity for farmers
Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.
Learn more about Rumi Spice 
###  Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger
When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.
Learn more about Cassvita 
[ Learn more about Cassvita ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/cassvita)
###  Helping organizations do good in Jamaica
Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.
Learn more about Do Good Jamaica 
[ Learn more about Do Good Jamaica ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2024/06/alumni-profile-deika-morrison-sm-98)
###  Perfecting a new language
When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.
Learn more about BoldVoice 
You may also like
##  Related In Focus topics
  * [ Innovations from Harvard  ](https://www.harvard.edu/in-focus/innovation/)
  * [ Research from 2024  ](https://www.harvard.edu/in-focus/what-we-learned-in-2024/)

    1. History of Harvard
About 
**History of Harvard** Harvard is perhaps best-known because of its enduring history of innovation in education. But even die-hard Harvard buffs are not likely to know all of these Harvard firsts and historical snippets.  [ Learn more about Harvard's history ](https://www.harvard.edu/about/history/)

#  Harvard University 
##  Ideas to Enterprise
Across Harvards campus, our students, scholars, and faculty turn ideas into ventures that solve problems and create value.
## [Foundational principles of leadership](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles)
In this [free online course](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/exercising-leadership-foundational-principles) you can explore strategies for leading in a changing world, new ways to approach complex organizational systems, and how to take thoughtful action.
##  Harvards impact
A 2015 study explored the impact that Harvard has in the business world.
  * 146,000 ventures
**Harvard alumni have founded**
  * 20 million people
**employed by those ventures**
  * $3.9 trillion
**generated in annual revenue**


![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/16x9.png)
How does innovation move from lab to market? 
##  Turning ideas into enterprise
Chief Technology Development Officer Isaac T. Kohlberg explains how Harvards Office of Technology Development helps researchers and scientists at the University bring their innovations and discoveries to the market.
![A group of company founders](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/themes/core/assets/img/theme/shims/four-three.png)
Student and alumni founders representing 12 different Harvard schools
Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenge
##  Founders with bright futures
Helping mothers protect their bodies during childbirth, reimagining how hydrogen can be transported safely and affordably, and leveraging AI and robotics to transform the thousands-year-old process of hair braiding are a few of the 2025 Harvard Presidents Innovation Challenges extraordinary winning ventures.
[ Learn more about the innovation challenge  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/05/redefining-whats-possible/)
##  The business of better health
These businesses join a history that includes Massachusetts General Hospital, founded by alum John Bartlett, and Partners in Health, founded by alum Paul Farmer.
[ Explore more emerging health technologies  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/industry-investors/emerging-technologies/)
![A person in a lab using a petri dish](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/kinvard-bio-lab.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Creating a new class of antibiotics
Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases.
[ Creating a new class of antibiotics ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/02/harvard-startup-creating-a-new-class-of-antibiotics-antimicrobial-resistance/)
###  Pioneering regenerative medicine
Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair.
![Nabiha Saklayen](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Nabiha-Saklayen-924.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Pioneering regenerative medicine ](https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/physicist-heal-thyself)
###  Decreasing eating disorder risk
Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk.
![Amanda Moreno](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Untitled-design-28.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Decreasing eating disorder risk ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/body-empowerment-project)
###  Detecting deadly lacing agents
MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs.
![Skye Lam and Vienna Sparks](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Skye-and-Vienna-filtered-1.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Detecting deadly lacing agents ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/mablab)
###  Transforming health care
Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients.
![Ivan Hsiao](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Ivan-Hsiao-PIC-pitch.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Transforming health care ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/trans-health-interview)
###  Listening to patients' needs
Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.
![Manny Simons](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9405_Simons_288w.jpg?w=288&h=281&crop=1)
##  Fostering the future
Harvard has several places where we help students and faculty turn research into start-up reality.
  * [ Harvard Innovation Labs  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Harvard Grid  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/)
  * [ Office of Technology Development  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/)


##  Education Entrepreneurs
These businesses join a history that includes alum Walter William Spencer Cook, co-founder of the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, and alum Edith Lesley, founder of Lesley University.
[ Explore more businesses making a social impact  ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/ventures/siff-recipients)
### [Exploring emotions through art](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/saturday-art-class)
Manasi Mehan and Chhavi Khandelwal founded Saturday Art Class to provide visual arts and social emotional learning education to children across India.
Joe Wolf believes his Imagine Worldwide can solve the literacy and numeracy crisis in sub-Saharan Africa.
### [Empowering the next leaders](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/butterfly-dreamz)
Joy Lindsay founded Butterfly Dreamz to help teen girls and young women from underserved communities become leaders.
### [Supporting social-emotional development](https://www.gse.harvard.edu/ideas/news/18/09/power-conversation)
When Jenny Woo created 52 Essential Conversations she aimed to help parents and educators through difficult conversations.
##  Team players
###  Getting it over the net
With League One Volleyball (LOVB) Katlyn Gao and Kim Kitchens designed a volleyball ecosystem from scratch.
Learn more about LOVB 
###  Promoting adaptive sports
Jorge Perez de Leza founded Fundacin Deporte y Desafo (Sport and Challenge Foundation) to provide athletic and recreational opportunities to people with disabilities in his home country of Spain.
Learn more about Fundacin Deporte y Desafo 
##  Founding the future of technology
These businesses join a history that includes alum Dan Bricklins VisiCalc, the first independent software company, and alum Scott McNealys Sun Microsystems, which created the Java programming language.
[ Explore more technological innovators  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/startups-licensing/)
![A person in front of a large tubed system](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9432_p58_Quantum.jpg?w=736&h=491&crop=1)
###  Computing with quantum
John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.
###  Finding his focus
Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies.
![Rob Devlin](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/METALENZ-RobDevlin-1920.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Finding his focus ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/03/from-harvard-lab-to-your-living-room/?utm_source=SilverpopMailing&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Daily%20%20Gazette%2020250326%20\(1\)&spMailingID=35875060&spUserID=MjE3NjUwMDkwMDA4S0&spJobID=2863966602&spReportId=Mjg2Mzk2NjYwMgS2)
###  Building together
Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.
![Shruti Shruti](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/9153_Shruti_880wb.jpg?w=375&h=258&crop=1)
###  Touching the future
Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology.
![Simon Chaput](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_9d6402d7c3fb43048628a1ca47a92011mv2b.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Touching the future ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/simon-chaput-president-and-founder-of-bor%C3%A9as-technologies)
###  Solving debt
Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt. 
![Rohan Pavuluri](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Screenshot-2025-04-02-at-11.14.39AM.png?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Solving debt ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2020/12/interview-upsolve-founder-rohan-pavuluri-18)
###  Owning your health
Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data.
![Laura Wegner talking to a crowd about her company Mii](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/HealthLab-Pitch-edited.jpg?w=375&h=281&crop=1) [ Owning your health ](https://globalhealth.harvard.edu/championing-health-tech-innovation-across-borders/)
##  Earth-friendly enterprises
These businesses join a history that includes alum Thomas Jaggars Hawaiian Volcano Observatory and alum Mark Plotkins Amazon Conservation Team.
[ Explore more climate related businesses  ](https://otd.harvard.edu/news/four-harvard-research-teams-receive-translational-funding-to-advance-climate-change-tech/)
![](https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/01_Membrane_Fun_trellis-1920.jpg)
###  Cooling without warming the globe
A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently.
[ Learn more about Trellis Air  ](https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2025/04/ac-use-to-surge-as-world-gets-hotter-harvard-startup-has-a-solution-climate-change/)
![](https://cloudinary.hbs.edu/hbsit/image/upload/s--BkyoUPiC--/f_auto,c_fill,h_360,w_640,/v20200101/2EB56C582389B82071DE566ED3EC4457.jpg)
###  Helping consumers decarbonize their purchases
Sanchali Pal founded the app Commons to help consumers make more climate-friendly purchasing decisions by allowing them to track and offset the emissions of everything they buy.
![](https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/PublishingImages/stories/bulletin/2024/december/next/9500-kelp-thumb.gif)
###  Fishing for a petroleum replacement
Matthew Perkins started Macro Oceans to find natural options like seaweed that can replace the petrochemicals in soaps, deodorants, and toothpaste.
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/04/02100514/cropped-Luke_fun-scaled-e1713810011212.jpg)
###  Spinning up a new food
Luke MacQueen founded Tender Food out of a desire to grow plant-based meat to feed the planet without harming animals.
[ Learn more about Tender Food  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/from-montreal-to-a-menu-near-you/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_efdfc99b7a2d434bae83302e16732f21mv2.png?w=400&h=407&crop=1)
###  Clearing the air
Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens.
[ Learn more about Metalmark  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/sissi-liu-co-founder-and-ceo-of-metalmark-innovations)
![](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Dec-9-1-copy.jpg)
###  Democratizing access to climate finance
Grace Lam calls her startup, NetaCarbon, TurboTax for carbon credits, and aims to bring transparency and accountability to the messy carbon market.
[ Learn more about NetaCarbon  ](https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/democratizing-access-to-climate-finance/)
![](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wyss-prod/app/uploads/2024/05/14152629/cropped-D85_48581.jpg)
###  Cultivating microbes that help the world
Shannon Nangle founded Circe to use gas fermentation to get microbes to help the Earth out in two ways: eat greenhouse gases and produce valuable products. 
[ Learn more about Circe  ](https://wyss.harvard.edu/news/circe-bioscience-licenses-technology-to-decarbonize-industry-with-microbes-developed-at-wyss-institute-at-harvard-university/)
![](https://www.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/994075_b19c8e8c7cad4017b31c6be3bcdc90bcmv2.png?w=400&h=400&crop=1)
###  Slowing down spoilage
Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer.
[ Learn more about Mori  ](https://www.grid.harvard.edu/post/adam-behrens-ph)
##  Solving global problems
###  Cultivating prosperity for farmers
Kimberly Jung and Emily Miller started Rumi Spice to brings saffron and other spices from Afghanistan to the United States and provides jobs for more than 1,500 farmers and other workers.
Learn more about Rumi Spice 
###  Empowering farmers and eradicating hunger
When Pelkins Ajanoh founded CassVita he set out to improve the methods for storing and processing cassava, a staple food that can feed nations and empower farmers globally.
Learn more about Cassvita 
[ Learn more about Cassvita ](https://innovationlabs.harvard.edu/articles/cassvita)
###  Helping organizations do good in Jamaica
Deika Morrison founded Do Good Jamaica to support projects around early childhood development, climate change, and emotional resilience in her home country.
Learn more about Do Good Jamaica 
[ Learn more about Do Good Jamaica ](https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2024/06/alumni-profile-deika-morrison-sm-98)
###  Perfecting a new language
When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers.
Learn more about BoldVoice

Learn more about Do Good Jamaica Learn more about Do Good Jamaica Perfecting a new language When Anada Lakra left Albania she quickly noticed a disconnect between the English she had learned and the one spoken in America, so she founded BoldVoice, an app that offers accent coaching for non-English speakers. Learn more about BoldVoice You may also like Related In Focus topics Innovations from Harvard Research from 2024 Gadgets Security & Brand Report Copyright Infringement Report Security Issue Trademark Notice Website Accessibility Digital Accessibility Privacy statement Get In Touch Contact Harvard Maps & Directions Jobs Copyright  2025 The President and Fellows of Harvard College

images.alt: A person in a lab using a petri dish
images.desc: Creating a new class of antibiotics Kinvard Bio, a biotechnology company launched out of the Harvards Myers Lab, is creating a new class of antibiotics in the hopes of treating drug-resistant infections and diseases. Creating a new class of antibiotics
Pioneering regenerative medicine Nabiha Saklayen founded Cellino to transform the bodys blood cells into tissues that can be used for healing and repair. Pioneering regenerative medicine
Decreasing eating disorder risk Amanda Moreno founded the Body Empowerment Project to improve students coping mechanisms and decrease eating disorder risk. Decreasing eating disorder risk
Detecting deadly lacing agents MabLab has been developing a single test strip to detect the five deadliest lacing agents in drugs. Detecting deadly lacing agents
Transforming health care Ivan Hsiaois founded Trans Health HQ to be a one-stop shop for clinicians seeking to improve care for transgender patients. Transforming health care
Listening to patients' needs Manny Simons founded Akouos, Inc. to develop gene therapies to restore hearing.

images.alt: A person in front of a large tubed system
images.desc: Computing with quantum John Levy hopes his startup SEEQC can turn quantum computers from an experimental technology into a commercially viable, enterprise-grade tool that will be exponentially more powerful than todays digital computers.
Finding his focus Metalenz, which Rob Devlin helped develop, has already shipped 100 million of its light-focusing metasurfaces to an array of electronics companies. Finding his focus
Building together Shruti Shruti founded ApnaKlub to create a digital platform that helps variety store owners in India aggregate their buying power and access credit tools.
Touching the future Simon Chaput founded Boras Technologies to improve how we interact with technology. Touching the future
Solving debt Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt. Solving debt
Solving debt Upsolve founder Rohan Pavuluri created the nonprofit to help Americans deal with their debt. Solving debt

images.alt: Laura Wegner talking to a crowd about her company Mii
images.desc: Owning your health Laura Wegner created Mii to empower patients to take ownership of their medical data. Owning your health
Cooling without warming the globe A novel system developed by the Harvard startup Trellis Air works like a coffee filter to dry and cool air more efficiently. Learn more about Trellis Air
Clearing the air Sissi Liu founded Metalmark to develop innovative air purification technologies that can remove harmful airborne particles, wildfire smoke, and pathogens. Learn more about Metalmark
Slowing down spoilage Adam Behrens started Mori to create an all-natural protective layer to slow down the spoiling process of food and keep fresher food for longer. Learn more about Mori
